briefdescription.para: Initialization parameters for a Time Server model instance.

memberdef.name: BT_MESH_MODEL_TIME_SRV
memberdef.initializer: BT_MESH_MODEL_CB( \ BT_MESH_MODEL_ID_TIME_SRV, _bt_mesh_time_srv_op, &(_srv)->pub, \ BT_MESH_MODEL_USER_DATA(struct bt_mesh_time_srv, _srv), \ &_bt_mesh_time_srv_cb), \ BT_MESH_MODEL_CB(BT_MESH_MODEL_ID_TIME_SETUP_SRV, \ _bt_mesh_time_setup_srv_op, \ &(_srv)->setup_pub, \ BT_MESH_MODEL_USER_DATA( \ struct bt_mesh_time_srv, _srv), \ &_bt_mesh_time_setup_srv_cb)

briefdescription.para: Time Server model composition data entry.

parameterdescription.para: Pointer to a Time Server model instance.

briefdescription.para: Publish an unsolicited Time Status message.

parameterdescription.para: Message context, or NULL to publish with the configured parameters.

simplesect.para: 0 Successfully published the current Light state.

parameterdescription.para: A message context was not provided and publishing is not configured.
The device has not been provisioned.

briefdescription.para: Get the time status at a given uptime.

detaileddescription.para: Converts the device uptime (from k_uptime_get) to TAI time.

simplesect.para: This function does not support status lookups for uptimes that occurred before the last received set- or status update. In addition, lookups for uptimes that happened before k_uptime_get must be used with caution, since there is no guarantee that the output data is fully reliable.

parameterdescription.para: Uptime at the desired point in time.
The device's Time Status at the given uptime.
Invalid uptime input. Asking for status that is in the past.

briefdescription.para: Get the device uptime at a given local time.

simplesect.para: This function does not support lookups for local time that occurred before the TAI-time of the last received set- or status update. In addition, lookups for local time that happened before k_uptime_get must be used with caution, since there is no guarantee that the output data is fully reliable.

Whenever a zone or UTC change makes the local time jump forward in time, i.e. for day light savings adjustments, we get a situation where some points in time will occur twice on the local timeline. If the user where to input a local time that is affected by these changes the respons uptime will reflect the input local time added with the new adjustment. Example: A time zone change is scheduled 12:00:00 a clock an arbitrary day to set the local clock forward by one hour. If the user requests the uptime for 12:00:05 at that same day, the returned uptime will be the same as if the user inputted the local time 13:00:05 of that day.

Whenever a zone or UTC change makes the local time jump backwards in time, i.e. for day light savings adjustments, we get a situation where some points in time never will on the local timeline. If the user where to input a local time that is affected by these changes the respons uptime will reflect the local time instance that happens last. Example: A time zone change is scheduled 12:00:00 a clock an arbitrary day to set the local clock back one hour. If the user requests the uptime for 12:00:00 at that same day, the returned uptime will reflect the local time that under normal circumstances would be 13:00:00 that day.

parameterdescription.para: Local time at the desired point.
uptime if successful, otherwise negative error value.

briefdescription.para: Get the device local time at a given uptime.

simplesect.para: This function does not support local time lookups for uptimes that occurred before the last received set- or status update. In addition, lookups for uptimes that happened before k_uptime_get must be used with caution, since there is no guarantee that the output data is fully reliable.

parameterdescription.para: Uptime at the desired point in time.
The device's local time at the given uptime.
to time struct if successful, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the device local time at a given uptime.

simplesect.para: This function does not support local time lookups for uptimes that occurred before the last received set- or status update. In addition, lookups for uptimes that happened before k_uptime_get must be used with caution, since there is no guarantee that the output data is fully reliable.

parameterdescription.para: Uptime at the desired point in time.
to time struct if successful, NULL otherwise.

briefdescription.para: Get the device time uncertainty at a given uptime.

simplesect.para: This function does not support uncertainty lookups for uptimes that occurred before the last received set- or status update.

parameterdescription.para: Uptime at the desired point in time.
uncertainty if successful, negative error code otherwise.

memberdef.argsstring: (struct bt_mesh_time_srv *srv, int64_t uptime, const struct bt_mesh_time_status *status)
memberdef.name: bt_mesh_time_srv_time_set

briefdescription.para: Set the TAI status parameters for the server.

simplesect.para: This is an alternative way to set parameters for the Time Server instance. In most cases these parameters will be configured remotely by a Time Client or a neigbouring Time Server.

briefdescription.para: Set the zone change parameters for the server.

simplesect.para: This is an alternative way to set parameters for the Time Server instance. In most cases these parameters will be configured remotely by a Time Client or a neigbouring Time Server.

briefdescription.para: Set the TAI UTC change parameters for the server.

simplesect.para: This is an alternative way to set parameters for the Time Server instance. In most cases these parameters will be configured remotely by a Time Client or a neigbouring Time Server.

briefdescription.para: Set the role parameter for the server.

simplesect.para: This is an alternative way to set parameters for the Time Server instance. In most cases these parameters will be configured remotely by a Time Client or a neigbouring Time Server.
